intro: Cryptantha grandiflora, commonly known as the largeflower cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and small, oval-shaped leaves. Cryptantha grandiflora is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
